Press Releases.Title: 29 New Cases of Locally Transmitted Covid-19 Infection
Press Releases.MainContent:
As of 19 August 2021, 12pm, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has preliminarily confirmed 29 new cases of locally transmitted COVID-19 infection. 11 are linked to previous cases, and have already been placed on quarantine. 5 are linked to previous cases and were detected through surveillance. 13 are currently unlinked.

2.      In addition, there are 3 imported cases, who have already been placed on Stay-Home Notice (SHN) or isolated upon arrival in Singapore. 1 was detected upon arrival in Singapore, while 2 developed the illness during SHN or isolation.

3.      In total, there are 32 new cases of COVID-19 infection in Singapore today.

4.      We are still working through the details of the cases, and further updates will be shared via the MOH press release that will be issued tonight.


MINISTRY OF HEALTH
19 AUGUST 2021
